Module common#

full_adder.v#

View source code on GitHub.

Full Adder module#
 1module full_adder (
 2    input a,
 3    input b,
 4    input cin,
 5    output sum,
 6    output cout
 7);
 8
 9    // Full adder combinational logic
10    assign sum  = a ^ b ^ cin;
11    assign cout = ((a ^ b) & cin) | (a & b);
12
13endmodule

\(\text{sum}= a~\oplus~b~\oplus~c\)

\(c_{out} = ((a~\oplus~b)~\&~c_{in})~|~(a~\&~b)\)

ripple_carry_adder.v#

View source code on GitHub.

Ripple Carry Adder module#
 1module adder100 #(
 2    parameter data_width = 100
 3)(
 4    input [data_width-1:0] a,
 5    input [data_width-1:0] b,
 6    input cin,
 7    output cout,
 8    output [data_width-1:0] sum
 9);
10
11    assign {cout, sum} = a + b + cin;
12
13endmodule

Warning

The drawback of the ripple carry adder is that the delay for an adder to compute the carry out (from the carry-in, in the worst case) is fairly slow, and the second-stage adder cannot begin computing its carry-out until the first-stage adder has finished. See carry_select_adder.v for a reduced computation delay.

carry_select_adder.v#

View source code on GitHub.

One improvement is a carry-select adder, shown below. The first-stage adder is the same as before, but we duplicate the second-stage adder, one assuming carry_in=0` and one assuming carry-in=1, then using a fast 2-to-1 multiplexer to select which result happened to be correct.

module top_module(
    input [31:0] a,
    input [31:0] b,
    output reg [31:0] sum
);
    wire [15:0] cout,con2;
    wire [15:0]alt_sum1, alt_sum2;
    add16 adder1(a[15:0], b[15:0], 0, sum[15:0], cout);
    add16 adder_sel1(a[31:16], b[31:16], 0, alt_sum1, con2);
    add16 adder_sel2(a[31:16], b[31:16], 1, alt_sum2, con2);

    always @(cout, alt_sum1, alt_sum2) begin
        case(cout)
            0 : sum[31:16] = alt_sum1;
            1 : sum[31:16] = alt_sum2;
        endcase
    end

endmodule

Warning

The carry select adder use more components.
